Subjects: Lord’s Prayer, as remedy against sins
_description: ‘Pater Noster in anglico’, the clauses of the Pater Noster as remedies against the sins — twelve lines in couplets

CULGg432.First Lines:
OVre fader in heuene richeÞin name be iblesced eure
                    iliche…
CULGg432.Last Lines:
…Led vs louers to non fondingeAnd sscild vs fram alle euel
                    þinge
CULGg432.Attributed Title:
Hic incipit oratio dominica in anglica lingua (f.
                    21ra)
CULGg432.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.159.

BLHar3724.First Lines: Vre fader in heuene richeÞi name be haliid euer iliche…
BLHar3724.Last Lines: …Ne lete vs falle in no fondingeAk scilde vs fro þe foule þinge
BLHar3724.Attributed Title: Pater noster in anglico (upper margin written by scribe, f. 49v)
